note.p: Education: Peterhouse, Cambridge; MA (1661), MA (1664); Incorporated at Oxford (1664); Middle Temple (admitted 1664)
Career: Called to the Bar (1671); Comptroller of the Chamber of London (1678); Bencher of the Middle Temple (1692), Reader (1694)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Venn; Hunter; Foster; MT; Birch
References: Michael Hunter, 'The Social Bias and Changing Fortunes of an Early Scientific Institution: An Analysis of the Membership of the Royal Society, 1660-1685' in NR 1976-7 vol 31 pp 9-114
